description: From Crossopterygia  +‎ -an, Greek krossoí “tassels, fringe” + -o- + pterýgion “little wing or fin,” equivalent to pteryg- (stem of pterýx ) “wing, fin” + -ion + -an.

entries.meaning: (zoology) Of or pertaining to the Crossopterygii, an infraclass of bony fish. [from 19th c.]
examples: One consequence was that the crossopterygian fishes (distantly related to the famous ‘living fossil’ coelacanth Latimeria) were dethroned from their privileged position as ancestors.
